document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

subSubSection.paragraph: ( 2 subfamilies, 2 genera, 3 subgenera, 29 species, 15 endemic species)

SUBFAMILY CEUTHOMANTINAE Heinicke, Duellman, Trueb, Means, MacCulloch &
Hedges 2009
, 6 ( 1 genus, 2 species).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
misspelled MacCulloch; also the use of subfamilies by those authors was inconsistent in regard to recent proposals.

Pristimantis Jiménez
de la Espada 1870, 61 ( 2 species). The date 1871 is frequently given (i.e.
Savage 2002
) for the Jiménez de la Espada publication proposing
Pristimantis
.
Myers & Grant ( 2009 )
briefly discussed the confusion surrounding the date of that publication.

Pristimantis ridens
species series ( 2 species). The two species listed in this series were listed as members of the
Eleutherodactylus cerasinus
and
E. cruentus
species groups in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
.

Pristimantis ridens
(Cope 1866, 131 ). Several populations of this color pattern variable species from northeastern Honduras resemble the color patterns of the morphologically similar
P. cruentus
(Peters 1873 [p. 609 ]) as shown by
Savage ( 2002 )
. Unfortunately, attempts at sequencing tissues from one of those populations failed.

SUBFAMILY CRAUGASTORINAE
Hedges, Duellman & Heinicke 2008
, 29 ( 1 genus, 3 subgenera, 4 species series, 27 species, 15 endemic species)

Craugastor Cope 1862
, 153 ( 3 subgenera, 4 species series, 27 species, 15 endemic species)

Subgenus Campbellius
Hedges, Duellman & Heinicke 2008
, 33 ( 8 species, 8 endemic species). The subgenus Campbellius equals frogs formerly placed in the
Craugastor milesi
species group (the companion publications
McCranie 2006
and
McCranie & Castañeda 2007
).

Subgenus
Craugastor Cope 1862
, 153 ( 4 species series, 18 species, 7 endemic species)

Craugastor ( Craugastor ) fitzingeri
species series ( 1 species). The following species was included in the
C. fitzingeri
species group in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
.

Craugastor ( Craugastor ) punctariolus
species series ( 9 species, 6 endemic species). The following species were included in the
C. rugulosus
species group in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
, with the exception of
C. megacephalus
, which was placed in a
C. biporcatus
species group in those works.

Craugastor emleni
(E) (Dunn 1932, 97 ).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
erroneously listed
Dunn & Emlen ( 1932 )
as the authors of this patronym honoring
Emlen. Dunn ( 1932 )
coined
Eleutherodactylus ranoides emleni
as a replacement name for the preoccupied E. r. nubicola of
Dunn & Emlen ( 1932 )
.

Craugastor ( Craugastor ) rhodopis
species series ( 2 species). The following two species were included in the
C. bransfordii
and
C. rhodopis
species groups in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
.

Craugastor loki
(Shannon & Werler 1955, 370 ).
Streicher et al. ( 2014 )
questioned the published identity of the single Honduran specimen of this form remaining in museums, even though those authors did not examine the specimen in question. I remain confident in my identification of that specimen as
C. loki
(see McCranie in
McCranie & Wilson 2002
).

Craugastor
(
Craugastor
) species series incertae sedis ( 6 species, 1 endemic species).
Padial et al. ( 2014 a)
could not assign the following species to a series, but its members correspond to the
C. gollmeri
species group in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
.

Craugastor laticeps
(A.H.A. Duméril 1853, 178 ). It appears that this nominal form is a complex with at least two unnamed species occurring in Honduras . One of those populations involves the Atlántida population listed in
McCranie ( 2006 , amphibian specimen list)
and another involves a recently discovered population in Santa Bárbara. Tissues of those populations, and others of this series, are available for study.

Craugastor rostralis
(Werner 1896, 350 ). This nominal form likely represents more than one species in Honduras , with those from Atlántida and Yoro probably representing a new species.

Subgenus
Hylactophryne Lynch 1968
, 511 ( 1 species, 1 endemic species). The following species was included in the
C. alfredi
species group in the companion publications
McCranie ( 2006 )
and
McCranie & Castañeda ( 2007 )
.
Craugastor cyanochthebius
(E)
McCranie & Smith 2006
, 185
